content.question: A meterstick with a uniformly distributed mass of <math alttext="0.5 kilogram" overflow="scroll"><mtext>0.5 kg</mtext></math> is supported by a pivot placed at the <math alttext="0.25 meter" overflow="scroll"><mtext>0.25 m</mtext></math> mark from the left, as shown. At the left end, a small object of mass <math alttext="1.0 kilogram" overflow="scroll"><mtext>1.0 kg</mtext></math> is placed at the zero mark, and a second small object of mass <math alttext="0.5 kilogram" overflow="scroll"><mtext>0.5 kg</mtext></math> is placed at the <math alttext="0.5 meter" overflow="scroll"><mtext>0.5 m</mtext></math> mark. The meterstick is supported so that it remains horizontal, and then it is released from rest. One second after it is released, what is the change in the angular momentum of the meterstick?
